intro: Launaya, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Launaya has showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and adapted to conserve water in dry environments. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds.
